reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The Plaza for 3 nights two weeks ago. We were given an upgraded room. The room was quite large compared to most NY hotels. The bathroom was also quite large with a separate tub and walk in shower, and separate water closet. The room came with butler service so we didn't have to pack or unpack. The location is great. The hotel is right next to Central Park. There is a subway stop across the street and The hotel is an easy walk to many mid-town and uptown locations. The only complaints we had concerned some construction noise coming in the early morning from a building across the courtyard under construction on 59th street. The concierge also forgot to notify us of a reservation they had made. However, the other items mentioned above outweighed this.
reviews.title: Great room, great service, great location

reviews.text: This hotel left nothing to be desired. Bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get up. Robes, slippers and awesome products were also part of the package. We didn't have time to try any of the restaurants, because we were there for so short a time, but I'm sure that it would be just as fantastic as the other services there. We did have frozen yogurt from the shops at the underground level. Although not actually part of the hotel, it was outstanding as well. I highly recommend The Plaza for your stay in NYC.
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodations

reviews.text: We were celebrating our daughters 16th bday and decided to stay at The Plaza since our girls had never been there. Having visited before we were anxious to see if it kept the grandeur and service it was known for. I would summarize as better in some ways but not the best in NYC.
reviews.title: Great hotel yet different from the "original"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are bigger with much better baths than the original hotel and have more modern amenities but they don't have the opulent charm of the original grand hotel. The service was hit and miss. We did encounter some issues with our reserved and requested room which then meant we did not get our virtuoso amenities in our room. Whoever had the room they held for us must have enjoyed our fruit and wine! Never once called by name as they always did in the old hotel and staff not very friendly. Fairmont Presidents Club member and they could have cared less. Everytime I needed a check for meals,drinks, etc, had to ask for it. Service very slow and unnattentive.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here a week ago and the location is just perfect. Shopping around the hotel is amazing on fifth ave.
reviews.title: As always

reviews.text: We loved Carlos! After touring my Mom around Central Park we went into the Plaza to have some tea but it was ending at 5pm. Sat at the front bar and ended up staying for over an hour enjoying great creations, Great wines by the glass. Love The Plaza drink and sure hope Carlos is there next time I go to NYC.
reviews.title: Sit at the bar in the lobby
Luxury experience
reviews.text: When I go to NYC for business, I always stay at the Plaza Hotel. It is well known luxury hotel, very welcoming since the very first moment you walk in the lobby, beside all the shops, coffee places and so on...
Exquisite and professional service, never seen before! Vanessa, the front desk responsible was so kind and attentive during my stay. She made me feel like at home away from home.
reviews.title: Didnt stay but beautiful restrooms

reviews.text: Great big rooms, some of them facing Central Park...what a view!
reviews.title: Beautiful, clean and old-fashioned rooms

reviews.text: Smoking room provide the finest Habanos cigars. Highly recommended! I will keep coming back...
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.text: A recent stay at the now Fairmont managed Plaza Hotel on Central Park South was a transformational experience. Entering the storied hotel I remembered that much had changed since the days when people like Keith Richards made it there home away from. After Donald Trump lost it in the divorce the historic landmark has been through the wringer, condos taking over the Central park Side of the property complete with their own entrance. Fairmont has decided to make a statement by returning the hotel to a true 5 star property worthy of it's rich history. Reception was flawless. Since the hotel was not completely full I requested and was given an upgrade to a spectacular balcony/patio room on the 5th floor. For three days our world became one of complete Central Park South luxury. The Chandeliers and gold plated fixtures added an elegant touch to our New York "Apartment" complete with the wonderful white gloved butler Gabriel. This is the way to enjoy New York luxury living at it's best. You can have the Ritz, Four Seasons etc for this traveler The Plaza at Central Park South is the address I prefer.
reviews.title: The Plaza is not just for Eloise anymore.

reviews.text: Our party stayed in a 2BR Suite at The Plaza hotel for 3 nights. There are many fancy, fun aspects about this hotel covered in other reviews. However, a hotel is only as good as its employees, and several of The Plaza's employees were severely deficient in service.
reviews.title: Doorman/bell/bar staff need lessons in customer service from Milton and Phillip at Palau Pacific Resort

reviews.text: I attempted to get the doorman to hail me a cab on 3 separate occasions, and, on all 3 occasions, the doorman failed to help me and I had to hail a cab myself. The first time, I asked politely and watched as the doorman assisted ladies who exited the hotel after me slide into a cab before me. I deferred because they were elderly ladies wearing pretty high heels and taking tiny steps, and I agree fancy geriatrics need to be seated much more quickly than a chick of indeterminable (but sufficient) age wearing Chucks and a backpack. I waited and asked again and he assisted more people (who were not me) into other cabs, and then I tucked my tip back into my pocket and walked towards 5th Avenue to get my own cab. This scene played out again the next night, with a doorman in hiding until Team Drunk Girls left The Plaza - I couldn't find him until the cab I had hailed pulled forward as I was about to get in it because the disappearing doorman had called it over to assist Team Drunk Girls. Truly, they needed the assistance and tumbled messily into the cab, but it's awfully frustrating that one must be elderly or drunk to get assistance. Again, I got my own cab, because, really, I can do that, but it's not fun when you're female and it's dark and there's a bellman who should be helping. Third night, I asked again ever hopeful and optimistic, but the doorman just couldn't seem to be bothered to assist me in hailing a cab. The tip went back in my pocket, and it stayed there with the other tips until the doorman at my friend's condo on the Upper West Side walked down the street to get me a cab and won the doorman tip lotto.
reviews.title: Location

reviews.text: Upon check-in, we also experienced a bellman awkwardly lingering for a tip even before assisting us to the room. We had it covered, but it was poor form on his part. It would have been much classier to just do his job and trust that the guests will tip.
reviews.title: No complaints!!

reviews.text: There were additional issues at the bar where one of our party requested a different champagne in his French 75. Despite having the champagne, the bartender said he couldn't use it in the French 75. It seems unfortunate to have to explain to a bartender at a luxury hotel that, if the bar has the champagne, the bar can use it and charge the guest more. However, this is what was required. A similar action was also required with our request to use a substitute liquor in another drink - the bartender told us, "you can't taste the difference once it has been shaken." That is something I'd expect a kindergarten teacher to say to a 5yo, but not something I'd expect from the bartender to a guest at The Plaza.
reviews.title: Very luxurious.

reviews.text: Excellent service throughout with the stark exception of the Palm Court restaurant. On check-in we asked for a quiet room and were immediately moved from the 9th to the 19th (and top) floor and got that rare NY commodity an almost silent room. Reception, room servicing and door staff are all excellent however the service in the Palm Court is appalling for this level of hotel. It appears to be staffed and managed by totally disinterested people. For breakfast instead go left out of the hotel, left at the coner and 100 yards away is the excellent SaraBeths which can teach the Palm Court everything about service.
reviews.title: Excellent but vfm?

reviews.text: Location on the corner of 5th and Central Park is great for the Park and midtown with generally plentiful taxis or 200 yards away the subway for furter away.
reviews.title: A stunning hotel in a perfect location

reviews.text: But value for money? At $950 a night for a deluxe room (even a quiet one) and even for a Fairmont managed hotel I'm afraid this might have been a one off visit.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The Plaza is a landmark and in a perfect location in New York City. I have stayed there several times. Last visit, there were some minor issues with the shower temperature on the upper floors and minor small electronic issues. On this visit, my room was absolutely perfect. A hotel is known by the friendliness and efficiency of its staff and everyone is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The Concierge Desk is one of the best. They made excellent dinner recommendations, and we were able to book in advance.
reviews.title: Below expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This stay was right after the Boston Marathon bombings so there was heightened security in and around the hotel. The hotel felt warm and comfortable.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea
